title: High Gasoline Prices Have Consumers Thinking Electric
sub_head: Interest in electric vehicles and shares of renewable-energy companies are up
body:
With gasoline prices setting records across the U.S. and oil topping $100 a barrel, consumer interest in electric vehicles and other clean energy technologies is speeding up.
Gasoline prices, which hit a nationwide average record high of $4.33 on March 11, are about $1.35 higher than they were a year ago, according to AAA. Every dollar of higher gasoline prices adds more than a $50 increase in householdsâ€™ monthly expenses, according to Northern Trust.
